#summary Specs for different types of output files
#labels Featured,Phase-Implementation

= Introduction =

== Text-based Output ==
Example Formatting for xml-based output:
{{{
<genes width="Width of Image" height="Height of Image">
  <genome gen="Your Generation Number Here">
    <polygon>
      <fill>
        <red>Red Value From 0 to 255</red>
        <green>Green Value From 0 to 255</red>
        <blue>Blue Value From 0 to 255</blue>
        <opacity>Opacity Value From 0 to 255</opacity>
      </fill>
      <shape>
         <point>
           <x>X Position</x>
           <y>Y Position</y>
         </point>
         <point>
           <x>X Position</x>
           <y>Y Position</y>
         </point>
         <point>
           <x>X Position</x>
           <y>Y Position</y>
         </point>
      </shape>
    </polygon>
    <polygon>
      <fill>
        <red>Red Value From 0 to 255</red>
        <green>Green Value From 0 to 255</red>
        <blue>Blue Value From 0 to 255</blue>
        <opacity>Opacity Value From 0 to 255</opacity>
      </fill>
      <shape>
         <point>
           <x>X Position</x>
           <y>Y Position</y>
         </point>
         <point>
           <x>X Position</x>
           <y>Y Position</y>
         </point>
         <point>
           <x>X Position</x>
           <y>Y Position</y>
         </point>
      </shape>
    </polygon>
    <polygon>
      <fill>
        <red>Red Value From 0 to 255</red>
        <green>Green Value From 0 to 255</red>
        <blue>Blue Value From 0 to 255</blue>
        <opacity>Opacity Value From 0 to 255</opacity>
      </fill>
      <shape>
         <point>
           <x>X Position</x>
           <y>Y Position</y>
         </point>
         <point>
           <x>X Position</x>
           <y>Y Position</y>
         </point>
         <point>
           <x>X Position</x>
           <y>Y Position</y>
         </point>
      </shape>
    </polygon>
  </genome>
</genome>
 
<difference format="Your Format Here">
  <comparison from="Generation Number" to="Generation Number">Difference Value</comparison>
  <comparison from="Generation Number" to="Generation Number">Difference Value</comparison>
  <comparison from="Generation Number" to="Generation Number">Difference Value</comparison>
</difference>
}}}

This example uses polygons as the entity that defines the image, but one could just as easily have {{{<line>}}}, {{{<rectangle>}}}, {{{<ellipse>}}}, or any other geometric shape (JUST KEEP THE NAMING CONVENTION STANDARD).  The contents of {{{<shape>}}} would have to be changed accordingly.
